Contradict fact: The claim that COVID-19 is a bacterium contradicts the fact that it is a virus.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that COVID-19 can be cured in one day if it is a bacterial infection.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough scientific evidence or support to back up the assertion that COVID-19 is a bacterium.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the World Health Organization (WHO) has intentionally deceived the world about the nature of COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides alternative explanations, such as the genome sequencing and identification of the virus as a new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), which contradict the claim that COVID-19 is a bacterium.
